2025-08-09 04:57:07

Code execution result:

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== ANALYZING DOWNLOADED SOURCES FOR CHARLES &#x27;PETE' CONRAD'S ASTRONAUT GROUP ===\n") print("Objective: Parse the successfully downloaded Wikipedia "keyword">and NASA sources to extract definitive astronaut group information\n") # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what files we have workspace_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir(&#x27;workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files "keyword">in workspace:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(workspace_files): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Let's first inspect the research summary JSON to understand what was found research_json_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in workspace_files "keyword">if &#x27;research.json' "keyword">in f] "keyword">if research_json_files: research_file = research_json_files[0] print(f"\n=== INSPECTING RESEARCH SUMMARY: {research_file} ===\n") research_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', research_file) # First, let's peek at the JSON structure "keyword">with open(research_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: research_data = json.load(f) print("Research JSON structure:") "keyword">for key "keyword">in research_data.keys(): value = research_data[key] "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" - {key}: list "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" - {key}: dictionary "keyword">with keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}{&#x27;...' "keyword">if len(value) > 5 "keyword">else ''}") "keyword">else: print(f" - {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}{&#x27;...' "keyword">if len(str(value)) > 100 "keyword">else ''}") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error reading JSON: {e}") exit() # Check the conclusion "keyword">if &#x27;conclusion' "keyword">in research_data: print(f"\nPrevious conclusion: {research_data[&#x27;conclusion']}") # Look at the group sources that were successfully accessed successful_group_sources = [] "keyword">if &#x27;group_sources' "keyword">in research_data: "keyword">for source "keyword">in research_data[&#x27;group_sources']: "keyword">if source.get(&#x27;access_successful', "keyword">False): successful_group_sources.append(source) print(f"\nSuccessful group sources: {len(successful_group_sources)}") "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(successful_group_sources, 1): print(f" {i}. {source[&#x27;url']} - HTML file: {source.get('html_filename', 'N/A')}") "keyword">if source.get(&#x27;conrad_found'): print(f" ★ Conrad mentioned "keyword">in this source") "keyword">if source.get(&#x27;group2_info'): print(f" ★ Group 2 information found: {len(source[&#x27;group2_info'])} items") "keyword">else: print("\nNo research summary JSON found") # Now let's focus on the Wikipedia source which should have the most comprehensive information wikipedia_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in workspace_files "keyword">if &#x27;astronaut_groups_4.html' "keyword">in f] # This was the Wikipedia source "keyword">if wikipedia_files: wikipedia_file = wikipedia_files[0] print(f"\n=== ANALYZING WIKIPEDIA SOURCE: {wikipedia_file} ===\n") wikipedia_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', wikipedia_file) "keyword">with open(wikipedia_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"Wikipedia HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse the HTML soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') # Extract the page title page_title = soup.find(&#x27;title') "keyword">if page_title: print(f"Page title: {page_title.get_text().strip()}") # Get clean text content page_text = soup.get_text() print(f"Clean text length: {len(page_text):,} characters") # Search "keyword">for Conrad specifically print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CONRAD IN WIKIPEDIA CONTENT ===\n") conrad_patterns = [ &#x27;Conrad', &#x27;Pete Conrad', &#x27;Charles Conrad', &#x27;Charles "Pete" Conrad', &#x27;Charles P. Conrad' ] conrad_mentions = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in conrad_patterns: "keyword">if pattern "keyword">in page_text: print(f"Found &#x27;{pattern}' "keyword">in Wikipedia page") # Find all occurrences "keyword">and extract context "keyword">import re matches = list(re.finditer(re.escape(pattern), page_text, re.IGNORECASE)) "keyword">for i, match "keyword">in enumerate(matches, 1): start = max(0, match.start() - 300) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 300) context = page_text[start:end].strip() conrad_mentions.append({ &#x27;pattern': pattern, &#x27;match_number': i, &#x27;context': context }) print(f" Match {i} context:") print(f" ...{context[:250]}...") print() "keyword">break # Found Conrad, no need to check other patterns # Search "keyword">for specific Group 2 information print(f"=== SEARCHING FOR GROUP 2 DETAILS ===\n") # Look "keyword">for the key information about Group 2 group_keywords = [ &#x27;NASA Astronaut Group 2', &#x27;Group 2', &#x27;New Nine', &#x27;Next Nine', &#x27;1962', &#x27;September 1962', &#x27;second group' ] group_info_found = [] "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in group_keywords: "keyword">if keyword "keyword">in page_text: print(f"Found &#x27;{keyword}' "keyword">in Wikipedia page") # Get context around this keyword matches = list(re.finditer(re.escape(keyword), page_text, re.IGNORECASE)) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 400) context = page_text[start:end].strip() group_info_found.append({ &#x27;keyword': keyword, &#x27;context': context }) print(f" Context: ...{context[:300]}...") print() # Look "keyword">for the astronaut roster/list print(f"=== SEARCHING FOR ASTRONAUT ROSTER ===\n") # Look "keyword">for patterns that indicate a list of astronauts roster_patterns = [ r&#x27;Front row[^.]*Conrad[^.]*', r&#x27;Back row[^.]*', r&#x27;astronauts[^.]*Conrad[^.]*', r&#x27;Conrad[^.]*Borman[^.]*Armstrong[^.]*Young', r&#x27;nine astronauts[^.]*selected' ] roster_info = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in roster_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) "keyword">if matches: print(f"Roster pattern &#x27;{pattern}' found:") "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches clean_match = &#x27; '.join(match.split()) # Clean up whitespace roster_info.append({ &#x27;pattern': pattern, &#x27;match': clean_match }) print(f" Match: {clean_match[:200]}...") print() # Look "keyword">for selection year "keyword">and details print(f"=== SEARCHING FOR SELECTION DETAILS ===\n") selection_patterns = [ r&#x27;selected[^.]*1962[^.]*', r&#x27;1962[^.]*selected[^.]*', r&#x27;Year selected[^.]*1962', r&#x27;September[^.]*1962[^.]*', r&#x27;announced[^.]*1962[^.]*' ] selection_info = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in selection_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) "keyword">if matches: print(f"Selection pattern &#x27;{pattern}' found:") "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches clean_match = &#x27; '.join(match.split()) # Clean up whitespace selection_info.append({ &#x27;pattern': pattern, &#x27;match': clean_match }) print(f" Match: {clean_match[:150]}...") print() # Save the Wikipedia analysis wikipedia_analysis = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_file': wikipedia_file, &#x27;page_title': page_title.get_text().strip() "keyword">if page_title "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;content_length': len(page_text), &#x27;conrad_mentions': conrad_mentions, &#x27;group_info_found': group_info_found, &#x27;roster_info': roster_info, &#x27;selection_info': selection_info } # Save analysis analysis_file = &#x27;workspace/wikipedia_analysis.json' "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(wikipedia_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"✓ Wikipedia analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") "keyword">else: print("\nNo Wikipedia source file found") # Let's also check the JSC biography source jsc_bio_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in workspace_files "keyword">if &#x27;conrad_bio_' "keyword">in f "keyword">and '.html' "keyword">in f] "keyword">if jsc_bio_files: jsc_file = jsc_bio_files[0] print(f"\n=== ANALYZING JSC BIOGRAPHY SOURCE: {jsc_file} ===\n") jsc_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', jsc_file) "keyword">with open(jsc_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: jsc_html = f.read() print(f"JSC HTML file size: {len(jsc_html):,} characters") # Parse JSC content jsc_soup = BeautifulSoup(jsc_html, &#x27;html.parser') jsc_text = jsc_soup.get_text() # Search "keyword">for group information "keyword">in JSC biography print(f"\n=== SEARCHING JSC BIOGRAPHY FOR GROUP INFORMATION ===\n") jsc_group_patterns = [ r&#x27;Group\s+2', r&#x27;second\s+group', r&#x27;1962[^.]*selected', r&#x27;selected[^.]*1962', r&#x27;New\s+Nine', r&#x27;Next\s+Nine' ] jsc_group_info = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in jsc_group_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, jsc_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: print(f"JSC pattern &#x27;{pattern}' found: {matches}") # Get context "keyword">for match_obj "keyword">in re.finditer(pattern, jsc_text, re.IGNORECASE): start = max(0, match_obj.start() - 200) end = min(len(jsc_text), match_obj.end() + 200) context = jsc_text[start:end].strip() jsc_group_info.append({ &#x27;pattern': pattern, &#x27;match': match_obj.group(), &#x27;context': context }) print(f" Context: ...{context[:200]}...") "keyword">break # Just show first match per pattern print() # FINAL ANALYSIS AND CONCLUSION print(f"\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS AND CONCLUSION ===\n") # Based on the evidence gathered evidence_points = [] "keyword">if wikipedia_files: evidence_points.append("✓ Wikipedia &#x27;NASA Astronaut Group 2' page accessed successfully") # Check "keyword">if we found Conrad "keyword">in the front row description "keyword">if any(&#x27;front row' "keyword">in info.get('context', '').lower() "keyword">and 'conrad' "keyword">in info.get('context', '').lower() "keyword">for info "keyword">in group_info_found): evidence_points.append("✓ Conrad mentioned "keyword">in &#x27;Front row' of Group 2 astronauts") # Check "keyword">if we found 1962 selection year "keyword">if any(&#x27;1962' "keyword">in info.get('keyword', '') "keyword">or '1962' "keyword">in info.get('context', '') "keyword">for info "keyword">in group_info_found): evidence_points.append("✓ 1962 selection year confirmed") # Check "keyword">if we found New Nine nickname "keyword">if any(&#x27;new nine' "keyword">in info.get('keyword', '').lower() "keyword">or 'next nine' "keyword">in info.get('keyword', '').lower() "keyword">for info "keyword">in group_info_found): evidence_points.append("✓ &#x27;New Nine' "keyword">or 'Next Nine' nickname confirmed") print("Evidence gathered:") "keyword">for point "keyword">in evidence_points: print(f" {point}") # Make final determination "keyword">if len(evidence_points) >= 2: # If we have at least 2 pieces of evidence print(f"\n🎯 DEFINITIVE CONCLUSION:") print(f" Astronaut: Charles &#x27;Pete' Conrad") print(f" NASA Astronaut Group: Group 2") print(f" Selection Year: 1962") print(f" Group Nickname: The New Nine (also called Next Nine)") print(f" Confidence Level: HIGH - tester Code Testing
2025-08-09 04:57:07

The code successfully parsed the Wikipedia 'NASA Astronaut Group 2' page and extracted all key information: Charles 'Pete' Conrad was a member of NASA Astronaut Group 2, selected in 1962, nicknamed 'The New Nine' (also called 'Next Nine'). The analysis found multiple evidence points including Conrad's mention in the 'Front row' of Group 2 astronauts, confirmation of the 1962 selection year, and the group nickname. The code created a final conclusion file 'conrad_astronaut_group_final_conclusion.json' with high confidence determination and saved detailed analysis to 'wikipedia_analysis.json' for reference. **PLAN** alignment: 100% complete - the research objective has been fully achieved with definitive identification of Conrad's astronaut group membership based on official NASA/Wikipedia sources. No further development is needed.

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== ANALYZING DOWNLOADED SOURCES FOR CHARLES &#x27;PETE' CONRAD'S ASTRONAUT GROUP ===\n") print("Objective: Parse the successfully downloaded Wikipedia "keyword">and NASA sources to extract definitive astronaut group information\n") # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what files we have workspace_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir(&#x27;workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files "keyword">in workspace:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(workspace_files): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Let's first inspect the research summary JSON to understand what was found research_json_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in workspace_files "keyword">if &#x27;research.json' "keyword">in f] "keyword">if research_json_files: research_file = research_json_files[0] print(f"\n=== INSPECTING RESEARCH SUMMARY: {research_file} ===\n") research_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', research_file) # First, let's peek at the JSON structure "keyword">with open(research_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: research_data = json.load(f) print("Research JSON structure:") "keyword">for key "keyword">in research_data.keys(): value = research_data[key] "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" - {key}: list "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" - {key}: dictionary "keyword">with keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}{&#x27;...' "keyword">if len(value) > 5 "keyword">else ''}") "keyword">else: print(f" - {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}{&#x27;...' "keyword">if len(str(value)) > 100 "keyword">else ''}") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error reading JSON: {e}") exit() # Check the conclusion "keyword">if &#x27;conclusion' "keyword">in research_data: print(f"\nPrevious conclusion: {research_data[&#x27;conclusion']}") # Look at the group sources that were successfully accessed successful_group_sources = [] "keyword">if &#x27;group_sources' "keyword">in research_data: "keyword">for source "keyword">in research_data[&#x27;group_sources']: "keyword">if source.get(&#x27;access_successful', "keyword">False): successful_group_sources.append(source) print(f"\nSuccessful group sources: {len(successful_group_sources)}") "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(successful_group_sources, 1): print(f" {i}. {source[&#x27;url']} - HTML file: {source.get('html_filename', 'N/A')}") "keyword">if source.get(&#x27;conrad_found'): print(f" ★ Conrad mentioned "keyword">in this source") "keyword">if source.get(&#x27;group2_info'): print(f" ★ Group 2 information found: {len(source[&#x27;group2_info'])} items") "keyword">else: print("\nNo research summary JSON found") # Now let's focus on the Wikipedia source which should have the most comprehensive information wikipedia_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in workspace_files "keyword">if &#x27;astronaut_groups_4.html' "keyword">in f] # This was the Wikipedia source "keyword">if wikipedia_files: wikipedia_file = wikipedia_files[0] print(f"\n=== ANALYZING WIKIPEDIA SOURCE: {wikipedia_file} ===\n") wikipedia_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', wikipedia_file) "keyword">with open(wikipedia_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"Wikipedia HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse the HTML soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') # Extract the page title page_title = soup.find(&#x27;title') "keyword">if page_title: print(f"Page title: {page_title.get_text().strip()}") # Get clean text content page_text = soup.get_text() print(f"Clean text length: {len(page_text):,} characters") # Search "keyword">for Conrad specifically print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CONRAD IN WIKIPEDIA CONTENT ===\n") conrad_patterns = [ &#x27;Conrad', &#x27;Pete Conrad', &#x27;Charles Conrad', &#x27;Charles "Pete" Conrad', &#x27;Charles P. Conrad' ] conrad_mentions = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in conrad_patterns: "keyword">if pattern "keyword">in page_text: print(f"Found &#x27;{pattern}' "keyword">in Wikipedia page") # Find all occurrences "keyword">and extract context "keyword">import re matches = list(re.finditer(re.escape(pattern), page_text, re.IGNORECASE)) "keyword">for i, match "keyword">in enumerate(matches, 1): start = max(0, match.start() - 300) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 300) context = page_text[start:end].strip() conrad_mentions.append({ &#x27;pattern': pattern, &#x27;match_number': i, &#x27;context': context }) print(f" Match {i} context:") print(f" ...{context[:250]}...") print() "keyword">break # Found Conrad, no need to check other patterns # Search "keyword">for specific Group 2 information print(f"=== SEARCHING FOR GROUP 2 DETAILS ===\n") # Look "keyword">for the key information about Group 2 group_keywords = [ &#x27;NASA Astronaut Group 2', &#x27;Group 2', &#x27;New Nine', &#x27;Next Nine', &#x27;1962', &#x27;September 1962', &#x27;second group' ] group_info_found = [] "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in group_keywords: "keyword">if keyword "keyword">in page_text: print(f"Found &#x27;{keyword}' "keyword">in Wikipedia page") # Get context around this keyword matches = list(re.finditer(re.escape(keyword), page_text, re.IGNORECASE)) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 400) context = page_text[start:end].strip() group_info_found.append({ &#x27;keyword': keyword, &#x27;context': context }) print(f" Context: ...{context[:300]}...") print() # Look "keyword">for the astronaut roster/list print(f"=== SEARCHING FOR ASTRONAUT ROSTER ===\n") # Look "keyword">for patterns that indicate a list of astronauts roster_patterns = [ r&#x27;Front row[^.]*Conrad[^.]*', r&#x27;Back row[^.]*', r&#x27;astronauts[^.]*Conrad[^.]*', r&#x27;Conrad[^.]*Borman[^.]*Armstrong[^.]*Young', r&#x27;nine astronauts[^.]*selected' ] roster_info = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in roster_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) "keyword">if matches: print(f"Roster pattern &#x27;{pattern}' found:") "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches clean_match = &#x27; '.join(match.split()) # Clean up whitespace roster_info.append({ &#x27;pattern': pattern, &#x27;match': clean_match }) print(f" Match: {clean_match[:200]}...") print() # Look "keyword">for selection year "keyword">and details print(f"=== SEARCHING FOR SELECTION DETAILS ===\n") selection_patterns = [ r&#x27;selected[^.]*1962[^.]*', r&#x27;1962[^.]*selected[^.]*', r&#x27;Year selected[^.]*1962', r&#x27;September[^.]*1962[^.]*', r&#x27;announced[^.]*1962[^.]*' ] selection_info = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in selection_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) "keyword">if matches: print(f"Selection pattern &#x27;{pattern}' found:") "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches clean_match = &#x27; '.join(match.split()) # Clean up whitespace selection_info.append({ &#x27;pattern': pattern, &#x27;match': clean_match }) print(f" Match: {clean_match[:150]}...") print() # Save the Wikipedia analysis wikipedia_analysis = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_file': wikipedia_file, &#x27;page_title': page_title.get_text().strip() "keyword">if page_title "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;content_length': len(page_text), &#x27;conrad_mentions': conrad_mentions, &#x27;group_info_found': group_info_found, &#x27;roster_info': roster_info, &#x27;selection_info': selection_info } # Save analysis analysis_file = &#x27;workspace/wikipedia_analysis.json' "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(wikipedia_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"✓ Wikipedia analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") "keyword">else: print("\nNo Wikipedia source file found") # Let's also check the JSC biography source jsc_bio_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in workspace_files "keyword">if &#x27;conrad_bio_' "keyword">in f "keyword">and '.html' "keyword">in f] "keyword">if jsc_bio_files: jsc_file = jsc_bio_files[0] print(f"\n=== ANALYZING JSC BIOGRAPHY SOURCE: {jsc_file} ===\n") jsc_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', jsc_file) "keyword">with open(jsc_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: jsc_html = f.read() print(f"JSC HTML file size: {len(jsc_html):,} characters") # Parse JSC content jsc_soup = BeautifulSoup(jsc_html, &#x27;html.parser') jsc_text = jsc_soup.get_text() # Search "keyword">for group information "keyword">in JSC biography print(f"\n=== SEARCHING JSC BIOGRAPHY FOR GROUP INFORMATION ===\n") jsc_group_patterns = [ r&#x27;Group\s+2', r&#x27;second\s+group', r&#x27;1962[^.]*selected', r&#x27;selected[^.]*1962', r&#x27;New\s+Nine', r&#x27;Next\s+Nine' ] jsc_group_info = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in jsc_group_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, jsc_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: print(f"JSC pattern &#x27;{pattern}' found: {matches}") # Get context "keyword">for match_obj "keyword">in re.finditer(pattern, jsc_text, re.IGNORECASE): start = max(0, match_obj.start() - 200) end = min(len(jsc_text), match_obj.end() + 200) context = jsc_text[start:end].strip() jsc_group_info.append({ &#x27;pattern': pattern, &#x27;match': match_obj.group(), &#x27;context': context }) print(f" Context: ...{context[:200]}...") "keyword">break # Just show first match per pattern print() # FINAL ANALYSIS AND CONCLUSION print(f"\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS AND CONCLUSION ===\n") # Based on the evidence gathered evidence_points = [] "keyword">if wikipedia_files: evidence_points.append("✓ Wikipedia &#x27;NASA Astronaut Group 2' page accessed successfully") # Check "keyword">if we found Conrad "keyword">in the front row description "keyword">if any(&#x27;front row' "keyword">in info.get('context', '').lower() "keyword">and 'conrad' "keyword">in info.get('context', '').lower() "keyword">for info "keyword">in group_info_found): evidence_points.append("✓ Conrad mentioned "keyword">in &#x27;Front row' of Group 2 astronauts") # Check "keyword">if we found 1962 selection year "keyword">if any(&#x27;1962' "keyword">in info.get('keyword', '') "keyword">or '1962' "keyword">in info.get('context', '') "keyword">for info "keyword">in group_info_found): evidence_points.append("✓ 1962 selection year confirmed") # Check "keyword">if we found New Nine nickname "keyword">if any(&#x27;new nine' "keyword">in info.get('keyword', '').lower() "keyword">or 'next nine' "keyword">in info.get('keyword', '').lower() "keyword">for info "keyword">in group_info_found): evidence_points.append("✓ &#x27;New Nine' "keyword">or 'Next Nine' nickname confirmed") print("Evidence gathered:") "keyword">for point "keyword">in evidence_points: print(f" {point}") # Make final determination "keyword">if len(evidence_points) >= 2: # If we have at least 2 pieces of evidence print(f"\n🎯 DEFINITIVE CONCLUSION:") print(f" Astronaut: Charles &#x27;Pete' Conrad") print(f" NASA Astronaut Group: Group 2") print(f" Selection Year: 1962") print(f" Group Nickname: The New Nine (also called Next Nine)") print(f" Confidence Level: HIGH - Based on official Wikipedia source "keyword">and multiple evidence points") # Create final conclusion final_conclusion = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;astronaut_name': "Charles 'Pete' Conrad", &#x27;nasa_astronaut_group': "NASA Astronaut Group 2", &#x27;selection_year': "1962", &#x27;group_nickname': "The New Nine (Next Nine)", &#x27;confidence_level': "HIGH", &#x27;evidence_points': evidence_points, &#x27;primary_source': "Wikipedia - NASA Astronaut Group 2", &#x27;sources_analyzed': len([f "keyword">for f "keyword">in workspace_files "keyword">if '.html' "keyword">in f]), &#x27;conclusion': "Charles 'Pete' Conrad was a member of NASA Astronaut Group 2, selected "keyword">in September 1962. This group was nicknamed 'The New Nine' "keyword">or 'Next Nine' "keyword">and consisted of 9 astronauts." } # Save final conclusion conclusion_file = &#x27;workspace/conrad_astronaut_group_final_conclusion.json' "keyword">with open(conclusion_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_conclusion, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"\n✓ Final conclusion saved to: {conclusion_file}") "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ Insufficient evidence gathered - need additional analysis") print(f"Evidence points found: {len(evidence_points)}") print(f"\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") # List final workspace contents print("Final workspace contents:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(&#x27;workspace')): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">if &#x27;final_conclusion' "keyword">in file: print(f" 🎯 FINAL ANSWER - Conrad&#x27;s astronaut group determination") "keyword">elif &#x27;wikipedia_analysis' "keyword">in file: print(f" 📊 DETAILED ANALYSIS - Wikipedia source breakdown") print(f"\nCONCLUSION: Based on the Wikipedia source analysis, Charles &#x27;Pete' Conrad was definitively a member of NASA Astronaut Group 2, selected "keyword">in 1962.")
📄 Output

conrad_bio_4_text.txt (16,594 bytes) - nasa_apod_january_21_2006.html (4,009 bytes) - nasa_apod_january_21_2006_data.json (1,000 bytes) - nasa_apod_january_21_2006_search.json (13,684 bytes) - nasa_apod_january_21_2006_text.txt (1,670 bytes) === INSPECTING RESEARCH SUMMARY: conrad_astronaut_group_research.json === Research JSON structure: - research_date: str - 2025-08-09 04:55:34 - objective: str - Determine Charles 'Pete' Conrad's NASA astronaut group membership - astronaut_name: str - Charles 'Pete' Conrad - biography_sources: list with 4 items - group_sources: list with 4 items - successful_bio_accesses: int - 1 - successful_group_accesses: int - 3 - conclusion: dictionary with keys: ['status', 'next_steps'] Previous conclusion: {'status': 'Inconclusive - additional research needed', 'next_steps': 'Search specialized astronaut databases or historical archives'} Successful group sources: 3 1. https://www.nasa.gov/astronauts/ - HTML file: workspace_0bdb7c40-671d-4ad1-9ce3-986b159c0ddc/astronaut_groups_1.html 2. https://www.jsc.nasa.gov/history/oral_histories/astronauts.htm - HTML file: workspace_0bdb7c40-671d-4ad1-9ce3-986b159c0ddc/astronaut_groups_3.html 3. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA_Astronaut_Group_2 - HTML file: workspace_0bdb7c40-671d-4ad1-9ce3-986b159c0ddc/astronaut_groups_4.html ★ Conrad mentioned in this source ★ Group 2 information found: 5 items === ANALYZING WIKIPEDIA SOURCE: astronaut_groups_4.html === Wikipedia HTML file size: 241,451 characters Page title: NASA Astronaut Group 2 - Selection pattern 'announced[^.]*1962[^.]*' found: Match: announced on September 17, 1962... ✓ Wikipedia analysis saved to: workspace_0bdb7c40-671d-4ad1-9ce3-986b159c0ddc/wikipedia_analysis.json === ANALYZING JSC BIOGRAPHY SOURCE: conrad_bio_4.html === JSC HTML file size: 380,217 characters === SEARCHING JSC BIOGRAPHY FOR GROUP INFORMATION === === FINAL ANALYSIS AND CONCLUSION === Evidence gathered: ✓ Wikipedia 'NASA Astronaut Group 2' page accessed successfully ✓ Conrad mentioned in 'Front row' of Group 2 astronauts ✓ 1962 selection year confirmed ✓ 'New Nine' or 'Next Nine' nickname confirmed 🎯 DEFINITIVE CONCLUSION: Astronaut: Charles 'Pete' Conrad NASA Astronaut Group: Group 2 Selection Year: 1962 Group Nickname: The New Nine (also called Next Nine) Confidence Level: HIGH - Based on official Wikipedia source and multiple evidence points ✓ Final conclusion saved to: workspace_0bdb7c40-671d-4ad1-9ce3-986b159c0ddc/conrad_astronaut_group_final_conclusion.json === ANALYSIS COMPLETE === Final workspace contents: - astronaut_groups_1.html (387,159 bytes) - astronaut_groups_3.html (380,342 bytes) - astronaut_groups_4.html (242,231 bytes) - conrad_astronaut_group_final_conclusion.json (787 bytes) 🎯 FINAL ANSWER - Conrad's astronaut group determination - conrad_astronaut_group_research.json (8,131 bytes) - conrad_bio_4.html (380,342 bytes) - conrad_bio_4_text.txt (16,594 bytes) - nasa_apod_january_21_2006.html (4,009 bytes) - nasa_apod_january_21_2006_data.json (1,000 bytes) - nasa_apod_january_21_2006_search.json (13,684 bytes) - nasa_apod_january_21_2006_text.txt (1,670 bytes) - wikipedia_analysis.json (23,007 bytes) 📊 DETAILED ANALYSIS - Wikipedia source breakdown CONCLUSION: Based on the Wikipedia source analysis, Charles 'Pete' Conrad was definitively a member of NASA Astronaut Group 2, selected in 1962.

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport json\n\nprint("=== NASA ASTRONOMY PICTURE OF THE DAY - JANUARY 21, 2006 ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Find APOD from January 21, 2006 showing two astronauts and identify which appears smaller\\n")\n\n# Create workspace directory if needed\nif not os.path.exists(\'workspace\'):\n os.makedirs(\'workspace\')\n print("Created workspace directory")\n\n# NASA APOD URL format: https://apod.nasa.gov/apod/apYYMMDD.html\n# For January 21, 2006: ap060121.html\ntarget_date = "January 21, 2006"\napod_url = "https://apod.nasa.gov/apod/ap060121.html"\n\nprint(f"Target date: {target_date}")\nprint(f"Direct APOD URL: {apod_url}")\n\nprint("\\n=== APPROACH 1: DIRECT ACCESS TO NASA APOD ARCHIVE ===\\n")\n\ntry:\n headers = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\'\n }\n \n print(f"Accessing: {apod_url}")\n response = requests.get(apod_url, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n print(f"✓ Successfully accessed APOD for January 21, 2006")\n print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes")\n \n # Parse content\n soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, \'html.parser\')\n \n # Extract title\n title_element = soup.find(\'b\')\n title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else \'No title found\'\n print(f"\\nTitle: {title}")\n \n # Extract the main content text\n content_text = soup.get_text()\n \n # Save the HTML content\n html_filename = \'workspace/nasa_apod_january_21_2006.html\'\n with open(html_filename, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(response.text)\n \n print(f"✓ HTML content saved to: {html_filename}")\n \n # Extract image information\n print(f"\\n=== EXTRACTING IMAGE INFORMATION ===\\n")\n \n # Look for image tags\n img_tags = soup.find_all(\'img\')\n print(f"Found {len(img_tags)} image tags")\n \n for i, img in enumerate(img_tags, 1):\n src = img.get(\'src\', \'No src\')\n alt = img.get(\'alt\', \'No alt text\')\n print(f" Image {i}: {src}")\n print(f" Alt text: {alt}")\n \n # Look for links to larger images\n links = soup.find_all(\'a\')\n image_links = []\n \n for link in links:\n href = link.get(\'href\', \'\')\n if any(ext in href.lower() for ext in [\'.jpg\', \'.jpeg\', \'.png\', \'.gif\']):\n image_links.append({\n \'href\': href,\n \'text\': link.get_text().strip()\n })\n \n if image_links:\n print(f"\\nFound {len(image_links)} image links:")\n for i, link in enumerate(image_links, 1):\n print(f" Link {i}: {link[\'text\']} -> {link[\'href\']}")\n \n # Extract the main description/explanation\n print(f"\\n=== EXTRACTING DESCRIPTION AND ASTRONAUT INFORMATION ===\\n")\n \n # APOD pages typically have the explanation after the image\n # Look for paragraphs or text blocks\n paragraphs = soup.find_all(\'p\')\n \n if paragraphs:\n print(f"Found {len(paragraphs)} paragraph elements")\n for i, p in enumerate(paragraphs, 1):\n p_text = p.get_text().strip()\n if len(p_text) > 50: # Only show substantial paragraphs\n print(f"\\nParagraph {i}: {p_text}")\n \n # Search for astronaut-related keywords\n astronaut_keywords = [\'astronaut\', \'spacewalk\', \'EVA\', \'extravehicular\', \'space suit\', \'spacesuit\']\n found_keywords = []\n \n for keyword in astronaut_keywords:\n if keyword.lower() in content_text.lower():\n found_keywords.append(keyword)\n \n print(f"\\n=== ASTRONAUT KEYWORD ANALYSIS ===\\n")\n print(f"Found astronaut-related keywords: {found_keywords}")\n \n # Search for specific astronaut names or references\n # Look for patterns like names in the text\n import re\n \n # Look for potential astronaut names (capitalized words that might be names)\n name_pattern = r\'\\b[A-Z][a-z]+\\s+[A-Z][a-z]+\\b\'\n potential_names = re.findall(name_pattern, content_text)\n \n if potential_names:\n print(f"\\nPotential astronaut names found:")\n for name in set(potential_names): # Remove duplicates\n print(f" - {name}")\n \n # Look for size-related descriptions\n size_keywords = [\'smaller\', \'larger\', \'bigger\', \'tiny\', \'distant\', \'close\', \'near\', \'far\']\n size_references = []\n \n for keyword in size_keywords:\n if keyword.lower() in content_text.lower():\n # Find context around the keyword\n keyword_pos = content_text.lower().find(keyword.lower())\n if keyword_pos != -1:\n context_start = max(0, keyword_pos - 100)\n context_end = min(len(content_text), keyword_pos + 200)\n context = content_text[context_start:context_end]\n size_references.append({\n \'keyword\': keyword,\n \'context\': context.strip()\n })\n \n if size_references:\n print(f"\\n=== SIZE-RELATED DESCRIPTIONS ===\\n")\n for ref in size_references:\n print(f"Keyword \'{ref[\'keyword\']}\' context:")\n print(f" ...{ref[\'context\']}...")\n print()\n \n # Extract all text content for detailed analysis\n # Clean up the text by removing extra whitespace\n lines = (line.strip() for line in content_text.splitlines())\n chunks = (phrase.strip() for line in lines for phrase in line.split(" "))\n clean_text = \'\\n\'.join(chunk for chunk in chunks if chunk)\n \n # Save clean text content\n text_filename = \'workspace/nasa_apod_january_21_2006_text.txt\'\n with open(text_filename, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"NASA APOD - January 21, 2006\\n")\n f.write(f"Title: {title}\\n")\n f.write(f"URL: {apod_url}\\n")\n f.write(f"Extraction Date: {datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\')}\\n")\n f.write("=" * 80 + "\\n")\n f.write(clean_text)\n \n print(f"✓ Clean text saved to: {text_filename}")\n print(f"Clean text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters")\n \n # Create structured data summary\n apod_data = {\n \'extraction_date\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'target_date\': target_date,\n \'apod_url\': apod_url,\n \'title\': title,\n \'html_filename\': html_filename,\n \'text_filename\': text_filename,\n \'content_length_chars\': len(clean_text),\n \'image_tags_count\': len(img_tags),\n \'image_links\': image_links,\n \'astronaut_keywords_found\': found_keywords,\n \'potential_names\': list(set(potential_names)) if potential_names else [],\n \'size_references\': size_references,\n \'paragraphs_count\': len(paragraphs)\n }\n \n # Save structured data\n json_filename = \'workspace/nasa_apod_january_21_2006_data.json\'\n with open(json_filename, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(apod_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n \n print(f"✓ Structured data saved to: {json_filename}")\n \n elif response.status_code == 404:\n print(f"✗ APOD not found (404) - may not exist for this date")\n else:\n print(f"✗ Failed to access APOD (Status: {response.status_code})")\n print(f"Response text preview: {response.text[:200]}...")\n \nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f"✗ Exception occurred while accessing APOD: {str(e)}")\n\nprint("\\n=== APPROACH 2: SEARCH ENGINE BACKUP ===\\n")\n\n# If direct access fails or we need more information, use search\napi_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY")\n\nif api_key:\n print(f"API key found: {api_key[:8]}...")\n \n search_queries = [\n \'NASA APOD "January 21, 2006" astronauts spacewalk\',\n \'site:apod.nasa.gov "January 21 2006" two astronauts\',\n \'"NASA Astronomy Picture of the Day" "January 21, 2006" EVA\',\n \'NASA APOD 2006 January 21 space suit smaller astronaut\'\n ]\n \n print(f"Executing {len(search_queries)} backup search queries...\\n")\n \n all_search_results = []\n \n for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1):\n print(f"Query {i}: {query}")\n \n params = {\n "q": query,\n "api_key": api_key,\n "engine": "google",\n "google_domain": "google.com",\n "safe": "off",\n "num": 10\n }\n \n try:\n search_response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params)\n \n if search_response.status_code == 200:\n results = search_response.json()\n \n if results.get("organic_results"):\n print(f" Found {len(results[\'organic_results\'])} results")\n \n for j, result in enumerate(results[\'organic_results\'], 1):\n result_info = {\n \'query_number\': i,\n \'result_number\': j,\n \'title\': result.get(\'title\', \'No title\'),\n \'link\': result.get(\'link\', \'No link\'),\n \'snippet\': result.get(\'snippet\', \'No snippet\'),\n \'is_nasa_apod\': \'apod.nasa.gov\' in result.get(\'link\', \'\').lower(),\n \'has_january_2006\': any(term in result.get(\'snippet\', \'\').lower() + result.get(\'title\', \'\').lower() \n for term in [\'january 2006\', \'jan 2006\', \'2006 january\', \'january 21\']),\n \'has_astronaut_reference\': any(term in result.get(\'snippet\', \'\').lower() + result.get(\'title\', \'\').lower() \n for term in [\'astronaut\', \'spacewalk\', \'eva\', \'space suit\'])\n }\n \n all_search_results.append(result_info)\n \n if result_info[\'is_nasa_apod\'] and result_info[\'has_january_2006\']:\n print(f" ★ RELEVANT NASA APOD RESULT {j}:")\n print(f" Title: {result_info[\'title\']}")\n print(f" Link: {result_info[\'link\']}")\n print(f" Snippet: {result_info[\'snippet\'][:150]}...")\n elif result_info[\'has_january_2006\'] and result_info[\'has_astronaut_reference\']:\n print(f" ◆ RELEVANT RESULT {j}: {result_info[\'title\'][:60]}...")\n else:\n print(f" Result {j}: {result_info[\'title\'][:40]}...")\n else:\n print(f" No organic results found")\n else:\n print(f" Search API Error: {search_response.status_code}")\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f" Exception during search: {str(e)}")\n \n print() # Space between queries\n \n # Save search results if any were found\n if all_search_results:\n search_summary = {\n \'search_date\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'target_date\': target_date,\n \'search_queries\': search_queries,\n \'total_results\': len(all_search_results),\n \'nasa_apod_results\': [r for r in all_search_results if r[\'is_nasa_apod\']],\n \'all_results\': all_search_results\n }\n \n search_filename = \'workspace/nasa_apod_january_21_2006_search.json\'\n with open(search_filename, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(search_summary, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"Search results saved to: {search_filename}")\nelse:\n print("No SERPAPI_API_KEY found, skipping search backup")\n\nprint("\\n=== INITIAL ACCESS PHASE COMPLETE ===\\n")\n\n# List all created files\nif os.path.exists(\'workspace\'):\n print("Files created in workspace:")\n for file in os.listdir(\'workspace\'):\n file_path = os.path.join(\'workspace\', file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n\nprint(f"\\nNext step: Analyze the downloaded APOD content to identify the two astronauts and determine which appears smaller")',

"description": 'PLAN SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED: The NASA APOD from January 21, 2006 has been successfully accessed and analyzed. Based on the extracted content, I can provide the complete answer:\n\n**APOD Details:**\n- Date: January 21, 2006\n- Title: "Apollo 12: Self-Portrait"\n- URL: https://apod.nasa.gov/apod/ap060121.html\n\n**Two Astronauts Identified:**\n1. **Charles \'Pete\' Conrad** - The photographer/astronaut who took the picture\n2. **Alan Bean** - The main subject collecting lunar soil on the Oceanus Procellarum\n\n**Which Astronaut Appears Smaller:**\nCharles \'Pete\' Conrad appears as the smaller astronaut. According to the APOD description: "The harsh environment of the Moon\'s Ocean of Storms is echoed in Bean\'s helmet, a perfectly composed reflection of Conrad and the lunar horizon." Conrad appears as a reflection in Bean\'s helmet visor, making him appear much smaller than Bean, who is the main subject in the foreground.\n\n**Complete APOD Content Extracted:**\nThe code successfully downloaded and parsed the complete APOD entry, extracting the title, full description, image details, and astronaut identification. The description explains this is a masterpiece photograph taken during Apollo 12\'s lunar mission in November 1969, showing Bean collecting lunar soil while Conrad\'s reflection is visible in Bean\'s helmet.\n\n**Files Created:**\n- nasa_apod_january_21_2006.html (4,009 bytes) - Complete HTML content\n- nasa_apod_january_21_2006_text.txt (1,670 bytes) - Clean text extraction\n- nasa_apod_january_21_2006_data.json (1,000 bytes) - Structured data\n- nasa_apod_january_21_2006_search.json (13,684 bytes) - Search verification results\n\nThe PLAN has been 100% completed with both astronauts identified (Conrad and Bean) and the smaller astronaut determined (Conrad appearing as a reflection in Bean\'s helmet).',
}
{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint("=== RESEARCH: CHARLES \'PETE\' CONRAD\'S NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Determine which NASA astronaut group Charles \'Pete\' Conrad belonged to and his selection year\\n")\n\n# Create workspace directory if needed\nif not os.path.exists(\'workspace\'):\n os.makedirs(\'workspace\')\n print("Created workspace directory")\n\n# From the previous APOD analysis, we know Charles \'Pete\' Conrad was an Apollo 12 astronaut\n# Let\'s research his NASA astronaut group membership using official NASA sources\n\nprint("=== APPROACH 1: NASA OFFICIAL ASTRONAUT BIOGRAPHY ===\\n")\n\n# NASA maintains official astronaut biographies\nnasa_astronaut_urls = [\n "https://www.nasa.gov/people/charles-pete-conrad/",\n "https://www.nasa.gov/astronauts/biographies/charles-conrad.html",\n "https://history.nasa.gov/SP-4029/Apollo_12a_Conrad_Biography.htm",\n "https://www.jsc.nasa.gov/Bios/htmlbios/conrad-cp.html"\n]\n\nprint(f"Attempting to access {len(nasa_astronaut_urls)} potential NASA biography URLs for Charles Conrad...\\n")\n\nconrad_bio_data = []\n\nfor i, url in enumerate(nasa_astronaut_urls, 1):\n print(f"URL {i}: {url}")\n \n try:\n headers = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36\',\n \'Accept\': \'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8\',\n \'Accept-Language\': \'en-US,en;q=0.5\',\n \'Connection\': \'keep-alive\'\n }\n \n response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n print(f" ✓ Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})")\n print(f" Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes")\n \n # Parse the content\n soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, \'html.parser\')\n \n # Extract page title\n page_title = soup.find(\'title\')\n title_text = page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else \'No title found\'\n print(f" Page title: {title_text}")\n \n # Save the HTML content\n html_filename = f\'workspace/conrad_bio_{i}.html\'\n with open(html_filename, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(response.text)\n \n print(f" ✓ HTML saved to: {html_filename}")\n \n # Extract text content\n page_text = soup.get_text()\n \n # Search for astronaut group information\n print(f"\\n === SEARCHING FOR ASTRONAUT GROUP INFORMATION ===\\n")\n \n # Key phrases that indicate astronaut group membership\n group_keywords = [\n \'astronaut group\',\n \'group 2\',\n \'group two\', \n \'second group\',\n \'selected\',\n \'selection\',\n \'chosen\',\n \'recruited\',\n \'1962\', # Group 2 was selected in 1962\n \'new nine\', # Group 2 was known as "The New Nine"\n \'next nine\'\n ]\n \n found_keywords = []\n keyword_contexts = []\n \n for keyword in group_keywords:\n if keyword.lower() in page_text.lower():\n found_keywords.append(keyword)\n \n # Find context around the keyword\n import re\n matches = list(re.finditer(re.escape(keyword), page_text, re.IGNORECASE))\n \n for match in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches\n start = max(0, match.start() - 200)\n end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 300)\n context = page_text[start:end].strip()\n \n keyword_contexts.append({\n \'keyword\': keyword,\n \'context\': context\n })\n \n print(f" Found \'{keyword}\' - Context: ...{context[:150]}...")\n \n # Look for specific years and group numbers\n print(f"\\n === SEARCHING FOR SPECIFIC DATES AND GROUP NUMBERS ===\\n")\n \n # Search for patterns like "Group 2", "1962", etc.\n group_patterns = [\n r\'[Gg]roup\\s+(\\d+|[Tt]wo|2)\',\n r\'(\\d{4})\\s+astronaut\',\n r\'astronaut\\s+(\\d{4})\',\n r\'selected\\s+in\\s+(\\d{4})\',\n r\'chosen\\s+in\\s+(\\d{4})\',\n r\'[Nn]ew\\s+[Nn]ine\',\n r\'[Nn]ext\\s+[Nn]ine\'\n ]\n \n pattern_matches = []\n \n for pattern in group_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE)\n if matches:\n print(f" Pattern \'{pattern}\' found: {matches}")\n pattern_matches.extend(matches)\n \n # Get context for these matches\n for match_obj in re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE):\n start = max(0, match_obj.start() - 150)\n end = min(len(page_text), match_obj.end() + 150)\n context = page_text[start:end].strip()\n print(f" Context: ...{context}...")\n \n # Store biography data\n bio_entry = {\n \'url\': url,\n \'url_number\': i,\n \'title\': title_text,\n \'html_filename\': html_filename,\n \'content_length\': len(page_text),\n \'found_keywords\': found_keywords,\n \'keyword_contexts\': keyword_contexts,\n \'pattern_matches\': pattern_matches,\n \'access_successful\': True\n }\n \n conrad_bio_data.append(bio_entry)\n \n # Save clean text for this biography\n text_filename = f\'workspace/conrad_bio_{i}_text.txt\'\n with open(text_filename, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"Charles \'Pete\' Conrad Biography - Source {i}\\n")\n f.write(f"URL: {url}\\n")\n f.write(f"Title: {title_text}\\n")\n f.write(f"Extraction Date: {datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\')}\\n")\n f.write("=" * 80 + "\\n")\n f.write(page_text)\n \n print(f" ✓ Text saved to: {text_filename}")\n \n elif response.status_code == 404:\n print(f" ✗ Page not found (404)")\n conrad_bio_data.append({\n \'url\': url,\n \'url_number\': i,\n \'access_successful\': False,\n \'error\': \'404 Not Found\'\n })\n else:\n print(f" ✗ Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})")\n conrad_bio_data.append({\n \'url\': url,\n \'url_number\': i,\n \'access_successful\': False,\n \'error\': f\'HTTP {response.status_code}\'\n })\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f" ✗ Exception: {str(e)}")\n conrad_bio_data.append({\n \'url\': url,\n \'url_number\': i,\n \'access_successful\': False,\n \'error\': str(e)\n })\n \n print() # Space between URLs\n\nprint("=== APPROACH 2: NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP HISTORICAL RECORDS ===\\n")\n\n# Access NASA\'s historical astronaut group information\nnasa_group_urls = [\n "https://www.nasa.gov/astronauts/",\n "https://history.nasa.gov/SP-4029/Apollo_00g_Table_of_Contents.htm",\n "https://www.jsc.nasa.gov/history/oral_histories/astronauts.htm",\n "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA_Astronaut_Group_2" # As a reference source\n]\n\nprint(f"Accessing {len(nasa_group_urls)} NASA astronaut group historical sources...\\n")\n\ngroup_data = []\n\nfor i, url in enumerate(nasa_group_urls, 1):\n print(f"Group Source {i}: {url}")\n \n try:\n response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n print(f" ✓ Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})")\n \n soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, \'html.parser\')\n page_text = soup.get_text()\n \n # Save HTML\n group_html_filename = f\'workspace/astronaut_groups_{i}.html\'\n with open(group_html_filename, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(response.text)\n \n print(f" ✓ HTML saved to: {group_html_filename}")\n \n # Search for Conrad specifically in group listings\n print(f"\\n === SEARCHING FOR CONRAD IN GROUP LISTINGS ===\\n")\n \n conrad_patterns = [\n \'Conrad\',\n \'Pete Conrad\',\n \'Charles Conrad\',\n \'C. Conrad\',\n \'Charles \\"Pete\\" Conrad\',\n \'Charles P. Conrad\'\n ]\n \n conrad_found = False\n conrad_contexts = []\n \n for pattern in conrad_patterns:\n if pattern in page_text:\n conrad_found = True\n print(f" ★ Found \'{pattern}\' in group source")\n \n # Get context around Conrad\'s name\n import re\n matches = list(re.finditer(re.escape(pattern), page_text, re.IGNORECASE))\n \n for match in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches\n start = max(0, match.start() - 250)\n end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 250)\n context = page_text[start:end].strip()\n \n conrad_contexts.append({\n \'pattern\': pattern,\n \'context\': context\n })\n \n print(f" Context: ...{context[:200]}...")\n break # Found Conrad, no need to check other patterns\n \n if not conrad_found:\n print(f" Conrad not found in this source")\n \n # Look for Group 2 or "New Nine" information\n print(f"\\n === SEARCHING FOR GROUP 2 / NEW NINE INFORMATION ===\\n")\n \n group2_keywords = [\n \'Group 2\',\n \'group two\',\n \'New Nine\',\n \'Next Nine\',\n \'second group\',\n \'1962\',\n \'September 1962\'\n ]\n \n group2_info = []\n \n for keyword in group2_keywords:\n if keyword.lower() in page_text.lower():\n print(f" Found \'{keyword}\' in group source")\n \n # Get context\n matches = list(re.finditer(re.escape(keyword), page_text, re.IGNORECASE))\n \n for match in matches[:1]: # Show first match\n start = max(0, match.start() - 300)\n end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 400)\n context = page_text[start:end].strip()\n \n group2_info.append({\n \'keyword\': keyword,\n \'context\': context\n })\n \n print(f" Context: ...{context[:250]}...")\n \n group_entry = {\n \'url\': url,\n \'source_number\': i,\n \'html_filename\': group_html_filename,\n \'conrad_found\': conrad_found,\n \'conrad_contexts\': conrad_contexts,\n \'group2_info\': group2_info,\n \'access_successful\': True\n }\n \n group_data.append(group_entry)\n \n else:\n print(f" ✗ Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})")\n group_data.append({\n \'url\': url,\n \'source_number\': i,\n \'access_successful\': False,\n \'error\': f\'HTTP {response.status_code}\'\n })\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f" ✗ Exception: {str(e)}")\n group_data.append({\n \'url\': url,\n \'source_number\': i,\n \'access_successful\': False,\n \'error\': str(e)\n })\n \n print() # Space between sources\n\nprint("=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS AND SUMMARY ===\\n")\n\n# Compile all findings\nresearch_summary = {\n \'research_date\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'objective\': "Determine Charles \'Pete\' Conrad\'s NASA astronaut group membership",\n \'astronaut_name\': "Charles \'Pete\' Conrad",\n \'biography_sources\': conrad_bio_data,\n \'group_sources\': group_data,\n \'successful_bio_accesses\': len([entry for entry in conrad_bio_data if entry.get(\'access_successful\')]),\n \'successful_group_accesses\': len([entry for entry in group_data if entry.get(\'access_successful\')])\n}\n\n# Analyze findings for astronaut group determination\nprint("FINDINGS ANALYSIS:")\nprint(f"Successfully accessed {research_summary[\'successful_bio_accesses\']} biography sources")\nprint(f"Successfully accessed {research_summary[\'successful_group_accesses\']} group sources")\n\n# Look for consistent patterns across sources\nall_keywords = []\nall_patterns = []\n\nfor bio in conrad_bio_data:\n if bio.get(\'access_successful\'):\n all_keywords.extend(bio.get(\'found_keywords\', []))\n all_patterns.extend(bio.get(\'pattern_matches\', []))\n\nprint(f"\\nKeywords found across sources: {list(set(all_keywords))}")\nprint(f"Patterns found across sources: {list(set(all_patterns))}")\n\n# Check if we found Group 2 or 1962 consistently\ngroup_indicators = []\nif \'group 2\' in [k.lower() for k in all_keywords] or \'2\' in all_patterns:\n group_indicators.append(\'Group 2\')\nif \'1962\' in all_patterns:\n group_indicators.append(\'Selected in 1962\')\nif \'new nine\' in [k.lower() for k in all_keywords]:\n group_indicators.append(\'New Nine nickname\')\n\nif group_indicators:\n print(f"\\n★ ASTRONAUT GROUP INDICATORS FOUND: {group_indicators}")\n research_summary[\'group_indicators\'] = group_indicators\n \n # Based on historical knowledge: Group 2 was selected in 1962 and nicknamed "The New Nine"\n if any(\'group 2\' in indicator.lower() or \'1962\' in indicator or \'new nine\' in indicator.lower() for indicator in group_indicators):\n research_summary[\'conclusion\'] = {\n \'astronaut_group\': \'NASA Astronaut Group 2\',\n \'selection_year\': \'1962\',\n \'nickname\': \'The New Nine\',\n \'confidence\': \'High - based on multiple source indicators\'\n }\n print(f"\\n🎯 CONCLUSION: Charles \'Pete\' Conrad belonged to NASA Astronaut Group 2")\n print(f" Selection Year: 1962")\n print(f" Group Nickname: The New Nine")\nelse:\n print(f"\\n⚠️ Need to search additional sources for definitive group information")\n research_summary[\'conclusion\'] = {\n \'status\': \'Inconclusive - additional research needed\',\n \'next_steps\': \'Search specialized astronaut databases or historical archives\'\n }\n\n# Save comprehensive research summary\nsummary_filename = \'workspace/conrad_astronaut_group_research.json\'\nwith open(summary_filename, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(research_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f"\\n✓ Comprehensive research summary saved to: {summary_filename}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== RESEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ===\\n")\n\n# List all created files\nif os.path.exists(\'workspace\'):\n print("Files created in workspace:")\n for file in sorted(os.listdir(\'workspace\')):\n file_path = os.path.join(\'workspace\', file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n \n # Highlight key files\n if \'research.json\' in file:\n print(f" ★ RESEARCH SUMMARY - Contains findings and conclusion")\n elif \'bio_\' in file and \'.html\' in file:\n print(f" ★ BIOGRAPHY SOURCE - Official NASA astronaut information")\n elif \'groups_\' in file and \'.html\' in file:\n print(f" ★ GROUP SOURCE - NASA astronaut group historical data")\n\nprint(f"\\nNext step: If needed, parse the successfully downloaded sources to extract definitive astronaut group information")',

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport re\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint("=== ANALYZING DOWNLOADED SOURCES FOR CHARLES \'PETE\' CONRAD\'S ASTRONAUT GROUP ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Parse the successfully downloaded Wikipedia and NASA sources to extract definitive astronaut group information\\n")\n\n# First, let\'s inspect the workspace to understand what files we have\nworkspace_files = []\nif os.path.exists(\'workspace\'):\n workspace_files = os.listdir(\'workspace\')\n print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:")\n for file in sorted(workspace_files):\n file_path = os.path.join(\'workspace\', file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\nelse:\n print("No workspace directory found")\n exit()\n\n# Let\'s first inspect the research summary JSON to understand what was found\nresearch_json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if \'research.json\' in f]\n\nif research_json_files:\n research_file = research_json_files[0]\n print(f"\\n=== INSPECTING RESEARCH SUMMARY: {research_file} ===\\n")\n \n research_path = os.path.join(\'workspace\', research_file)\n \n # First, let\'s peek at the JSON structure\n with open(research_path, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n try:\n research_data = json.load(f)\n print("Research JSON structure:")\n for key in research_data.keys():\n value = research_data[key]\n if isinstance(value, list):\n print(f" - {key}: list with {len(value)} items")\n elif isinstance(value, dict):\n print(f" - {key}: dictionary with keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}{\'...\' if len(value) > 5 else \'\'}")\n else:\n print(f" - {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}{\'...\' if len(str(value)) > 100 else \'\'}")\n except json.JSONDecodeError as e:\n print(f"Error reading JSON: {e}")\n exit()\n \n # Check the conclusion\n if \'conclusion\' in research_data:\n print(f"\\nPrevious conclusion: {research_data[\'conclusion\']}")\n \n # Look at the group sources that were successfully accessed\n successful_group_sources = []\n if \'group_sources\' in research_data:\n for source in research_data[\'group_sources\']:\n if source.get(\'access_successful\', False):\n successful_group_sources.append(source)\n \n print(f"\\nSuccessful group sources: {len(successful_group_sources)}")\n for i, source in enumerate(successful_group_sources, 1):\n print(f" {i}. {source[\'url\']} - HTML file: {source.get(\'html_filename\', \'N/A\')}")\n if source.get(\'conrad_found\'):\n print(f" ★ Conrad mentioned in this source")\n if source.get(\'group2_info\'):\n print(f" ★ Group 2 information found: {len(source[\'group2_info\'])} items")\nelse:\n print("\\nNo research summary JSON found")\n\n# Now let\'s focus on the Wikipedia source which should have the most comprehensive information\nwikipedia_files = [f for f in workspace_files if \'astronaut_groups_4.html\' in f] # This was the Wikipedia source\n\nif wikipedia_files:\n wikipedia_file = wikipedia_files[0]\n print(f"\\n=== ANALYZING WIKIPEDIA SOURCE: {wikipedia_file} ===\\n")\n \n wikipedia_path = os.path.join(\'workspace\', wikipedia_file)\n \n with open(wikipedia_path, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n html_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"Wikipedia HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters")\n \n # Parse the HTML\n soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, \'html.parser\')\n \n # Extract the page title\n page_title = soup.find(\'title\')\n if page_title:\n print(f"Page title: {page_title.get_text().strip()}")\n \n # Get clean text content\n page_text = soup.get_text()\n print(f"Clean text length: {len(page_text):,} characters")\n \n # Search for Conrad specifically\n print(f"\\n=== SEARCHING FOR CONRAD IN WIKIPEDIA CONTENT ===\\n")\n \n conrad_patterns = [\n \'Conrad\',\n \'Pete Conrad\', \n \'Charles Conrad\',\n \'Charles "Pete" Conrad\',\n \'Charles P. Conrad\'\n ]\n \n conrad_mentions = []\n \n for pattern in conrad_patterns:\n if pattern in page_text:\n print(f"Found \'{pattern}\' in Wikipedia page")\n \n # Find all occurrences and extract context\n import re\n matches = list(re.finditer(re.escape(pattern), page_text, re.IGNORECASE))\n \n for i, match in enumerate(matches, 1):\n start = max(0, match.start() - 300)\n end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 300)\n context = page_text[start:end].strip()\n \n conrad_mentions.append({\n \'pattern\': pattern,\n \'match_number\': i,\n \'context\': context\n })\n \n print(f" Match {i} context:")\n print(f" ...{context[:250]}...")\n print()\n \n break # Found Conrad, no need to check other patterns\n \n # Search for specific Group 2 information\n print(f"=== SEARCHING FOR GROUP 2 DETAILS ===\\n")\n \n # Look for the key information about Group 2\n group_keywords = [\n \'NASA Astronaut Group 2\',\n \'Group 2\',\n \'New Nine\',\n \'Next Nine\',\n \'1962\',\n \'September 1962\',\n \'second group\'\n ]\n \n group_info_found = []\n \n for keyword in group_keywords:\n if keyword in page_text:\n print(f"Found \'{keyword}\' in Wikipedia page")\n \n # Get context around this keyword\n matches = list(re.finditer(re.escape(keyword), page_text, re.IGNORECASE))\n \n for match in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches\n start = max(0, match.start() - 200)\n end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 400)\n context = page_text[start:end].strip()\n \n group_info_found.append({\n \'keyword\': keyword,\n \'context\': context\n })\n \n print(f" Context: ...{context[:300]}...")\n print()\n \n # Look for the astronaut roster/list\n print(f"=== SEARCHING FOR ASTRONAUT ROSTER ===\\n")\n \n # Look for patterns that indicate a list of astronauts\n roster_patterns = [\n r\'Front row[^.]*Conrad[^.]*\',\n r\'Back row[^.]*\',\n r\'astronauts[^.]*Conrad[^.]*\',\n r\'Conrad[^.]*Borman[^.]*Armstrong[^.]*Young\',\n r\'nine astronauts[^.]*selected\'\n ]\n \n roster_info = []\n \n for pattern in roster_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL)\n if matches:\n print(f"Roster pattern \'{pattern}\' found:")\n for match in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches\n clean_match = \' \'.join(match.split()) # Clean up whitespace\n roster_info.append({\n \'pattern\': pattern,\n \'match\': clean_match\n })\n print(f" Match: {clean_match[:200]}...")\n print()\n \n # Look for selection year and details\n print(f"=== SEARCHING FOR SELECTION DETAILS ===\\n")\n \n selection_patterns = [\n r\'selected[^.]*1962[^.]*\',\n r\'1962[^.]*selected[^.]*\',\n r\'Year selected[^.]*1962\',\n r\'September[^.]*1962[^.]*\',\n r\'announced[^.]*1962[^.]*\'\n ]\n \n selection_info = []\n \n for pattern in selection_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL)\n if matches:\n print(f"Selection pattern \'{pattern}\' found:")\n for match in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches\n clean_match = \' \'.join(match.split()) # Clean up whitespace\n selection_info.append({\n \'pattern\': pattern,\n \'match\': clean_match\n })\n print(f" Match: {clean_match[:150]}...")\n print()\n \n # Save the Wikipedia analysis\n wikipedia_analysis = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'source_file\': wikipedia_file,\n \'page_title\': page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else None,\n \'content_length\': len(page_text),\n \'conrad_mentions\': conrad_mentions,\n \'group_info_found\': group_info_found,\n \'roster_info\': roster_info,\n \'selection_info\': selection_info\n }\n \n # Save analysis\n analysis_file = \'workspace/wikipedia_analysis.json\'\n with open(analysis_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(wikipedia_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n \n print(f"✓ Wikipedia analysis saved to: {analysis_file}")\n \nelse:\n print("\\nNo Wikipedia source file found")\n\n# Let\'s also check the JSC biography source\njsc_bio_files = [f for f in workspace_files if \'conrad_bio_\' in f and \'.html\' in f]\n\nif jsc_bio_files:\n jsc_file = jsc_bio_files[0]\n print(f"\\n=== ANALYZING JSC BIOGRAPHY SOURCE: {jsc_file} ===\\n")\n \n jsc_path = os.path.join(\'workspace\', jsc_file)\n \n with open(jsc_path, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n jsc_html = f.read()\n \n print(f"JSC HTML file size: {len(jsc_html):,} characters")\n \n # Parse JSC content\n jsc_soup = BeautifulSoup(jsc_html, \'html.parser\')\n jsc_text = jsc_soup.get_text()\n \n # Search for group information in JSC biography\n print(f"\\n=== SEARCHING JSC BIOGRAPHY FOR GROUP INFORMATION ===\\n")\n \n jsc_group_patterns = [\n r\'Group\\s+2\',\n r\'second\\s+group\',\n r\'1962[^.]*selected\',\n r\'selected[^.]*1962\',\n r\'New\\s+Nine\',\n r\'Next\\s+Nine\'\n ]\n \n jsc_group_info = []\n \n for pattern in jsc_group_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, jsc_text, re.IGNORECASE)\n if matches:\n print(f"JSC pattern \'{pattern}\' found: {matches}")\n \n # Get context\n for match_obj in re.finditer(pattern, jsc_text, re.IGNORECASE):\n start = max(0, match_obj.start() - 200)\n end = min(len(jsc_text), match_obj.end() + 200)\n context = jsc_text[start:end].strip()\n \n jsc_group_info.append({\n \'pattern\': pattern,\n \'match\': match_obj.group(),\n \'context\': context\n })\n \n print(f" Context: ...{context[:200]}...")\n break # Just show first match per pattern\n print()\n\n# FINAL ANALYSIS AND CONCLUSION\nprint(f"\\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS AND CONCLUSION ===\\n")\n\n# Based on the evidence gathered\nevidence_points = []\n\nif wikipedia_files:\n evidence_points.append("✓ Wikipedia \'NASA Astronaut Group 2\' page accessed successfully")\n \n # Check if we found Conrad in the front row description\n if any(\'front row\' in info.get(\'context\', \'\').lower() and \'conrad\' in info.get(\'context\', \'\').lower() \n for info in group_info_found):\n evidence_points.append("✓ Conrad mentioned in \'Front row\' of Group 2 astronauts")\n \n # Check if we found 1962 selection year\n if any(\'1962\' in info.get(\'keyword\', \'\') or \'1962\' in info.get(\'context\', \'\') \n for info in group_info_found):\n evidence_points.append("✓ 1962 selection year confirmed")\n \n # Check if we found New Nine nickname\n if any(\'new nine\' in info.get(\'keyword\', \'\').lower() or \'next nine\' in info.get(\'keyword\', \'\').lower() \n for info in group_info_found):\n evidence_points.append("✓ \'New Nine\' or \'Next Nine\' nickname confirmed")\n\nprint("Evidence gathered:")\nfor point in evidence_points:\n print(f" {point}")\n\n# Make final determination\nif len(evidence_points) >= 2: # If we have at least 2 pieces of evidence\n print(f"\\n🎯 DEFINITIVE CONCLUSION:")\n print(f" Astronaut: Charles \'Pete\' Conrad")\n print(f" NASA Astronaut Group: Group 2")\n print(f" Selection Year: 1962")\n print(f" Group Nickname: The New Nine (also called Next Nine)")\n print(f" Confidence Level: HIGH - Based on official Wikipedia source and multiple evidence points")\n \n # Create final conclusion\n final_conclusion = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'astronaut_name\': "Charles \'Pete\' Conrad",\n \'nasa_astronaut_group\': "NASA Astronaut Group 2",\n \'selection_year\': "1962",\n \'group_nickname\': "The New Nine (Next Nine)",\n \'confidence_level\': "HIGH",\n \'evidence_points\': evidence_points,\n \'primary_source\': "Wikipedia - NASA Astronaut Group 2",\n \'sources_analyzed\': len([f for f in workspace_files if \'.html\' in f]),\n \'conclusion\': "Charles \'Pete\' Conrad was a member of NASA Astronaut Group 2, selected in September 1962. This group was nicknamed \'The New Nine\' or \'Next Nine\' and consisted of 9 astronauts."\n }\n \n # Save final conclusion\n conclusion_file = \'workspace/conrad_astronaut_group_final_conclusion.json\'\n with open(conclusion_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(final_conclusion, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n \n print(f"\\n✓ Final conclusion saved to: {conclusion_file}")\n \nelse:\n print(f"\\n⚠️ Insufficient evidence gathered - need additional analysis")\n print(f"Evidence points found: {len(evidence_points)}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\\n")\n\n# List final workspace contents\nprint("Final workspace contents:")\nfor file in sorted(os.listdir(\'workspace\')):\n file_path = os.path.join(\'workspace\', file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n \n if \'final_conclusion\' in file:\n print(f" 🎯 FINAL ANSWER - Conrad\'s astronaut group determination")\n elif \'wikipedia_analysis\' in file:\n print(f" 📊 DETAILED ANALYSIS - Wikipedia source breakdown")\n\nprint(f"\\nCONCLUSION: Based on the Wikipedia source analysis, Charles \'Pete\' Conrad was definitively a member of NASA Astronaut Group 2, selected in 1962.")',
